edition: Nuovi Papiri Letterari Fiorentini, Marburg, 1971, p. 27-28, no. 6 (M. Lallai) = Papiri Letterari Greci no. 22 (A. Carlini, 1978)
bibliography: F. Montanari, Anagennesis 2 (1982), p. 273-278 (= Studi di filologia omerica antica, vol. 2, Pisa, 1995, p. 87-90).
plates: Carlini, pl. IX; Montanari, pl. II

author: anon.
contents: end of hypothesis to Il. 3 (in accordance with the manuscript tradition), followed by an "epigraphê".
frontback: document, AD 6 (end), also along the fibres
statepreservation: remains of 4 lines from the bottom of a column, broken to the left, followed by a blank line and the title.
hand: large, informal, mixed round, influenced by chancery style, leaning forward, generally bilinear (except for very long tails of ?, ? and ?), regular, written with a thin pen by a proficient scribe ("an advanced student or a teacher", according to Cribiore), mostly separating the letters.
